conclusion: A particle is moving in a straight line along the x-axis. At the moment t=0, the particle is at rest. The graph shows the relationship between its coordinate x and the square of time t².
The image depicts a graph with the x-axis representing the position x and the y-axis representing the square of time t². The graph shows a linear relationship between these two variables.

premise: The graph shows a linear relationship between x and t².
conclusion: The position x of the particle is proportional to t².

premise: The position x of the particle is proportional to t².
conclusion: This can be expressed as x = (1/2) * t².
The velocity v is the derivative of x with respect to time t, giving v = t.
The acceleration a is the derivative of velocity v with respect to time t, therefore a = 1.

premise: The problem asks for the magnitude of the acceleration.
conclusion: The magnitude of the acceleration is 1 m/s².
